title.narrative: F.a: Strengthening Civil Society Organisations? Interventions in Human Rights through ICT

description.narrative: The main goal of the project is to capacitate local organisations driven by youth outside Kampala. The capacitation focuses mainly on utilizing digital media in highlighting the human rights situation. According to the Unwanted Witness youth organisations at community level are doing excellent human rights work, but their voice rarely reaches the larger masses, which leads to that the human rights situations in communities are not paid attention to. The Unwanted Witness is a young organization founded in 20 12 and registered in 2013. The organization was founded by a group of human rights defenders, including journalists and lawyers, led by Geoffrey Wokulira Ssebaggala. Ssebaggala received the European Union human rights defender award in 2013. The Unwanted W itness seeks to promote and maintain freedom of expression as well as improve responsible state governance. In addition the organization advocates amongst others for improving freedom of expression and democracy, and participates in trials to enhance freed om of speech in the context of internet usage. www.unwantedwitness.or.ug
